name: places/ChIJU6ouUIBZwokRnEpLypClM0Y
formattedAddress: 170 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 170 Delancey St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text: He's been fixing my shoes for years now, including the same boot I bring him every 6 months or so. He does a great job, explains what needed doing, and charges fairly. He's even fixed a vegan leather bag, my ice skates... Stellar service, I just wish it wasn't cash only! All in all great experience every time.

text.text: He's been fixing my shoes for years now, including the same boot I bring him every 6 months or so. He does a great job, explains what needed doing, and charges fairly. He's even fixed a vegan leather bag, my ice skates... Stellar service, I just wish it wasn't cash only! All in all great experience every time.

originalText.text: Great shoe repair and has fixed a few trinkets and belt for me! We no longer live in the neighborhood but we will make the trip to see him for anything we need. Highly recommend! -EM

text.text: Great shoe repair and has fixed a few trinkets and belt for me! We no longer live in the neighborhood but we will make the trip to see him for anything we need. Highly recommend! -EM

originalText.text: I don’t know about this guy. First impression is that he is very rude. Snobbish, stuck up. He’s been giving me prices that seem waaaaay too over priced. He’s not nice and quite offensive. I’m assuming he’s the boss of the store. Bald French guy. Handsome looking but miserable attitude. He lighten up a few times but his default is grumpy.

text.text: I don’t know about this guy. First impression is that he is very rude. Snobbish, stuck up. He’s been giving me prices that seem waaaaay too over priced. He’s not nice and quite offensive. I’m assuming he’s the boss of the store. Bald French guy. Handsome looking but miserable attitude. He lighten up a few times but his default is grumpy.

originalText.text:
Think twice before bringing in your bag for repair  - I came in for a zipper repair on a Marc Jacobs leather backpack and the owner told me he could take care of it. The main zipper was broken in the way that the nearby fabric was starting to fray from normal wear and tear through the ~3 years I owned the item.
The repair was shoddy, bag is completely botched. Maybe I’m stupid for bringing it to a shoe repair shop lol but would’ve loved some honestly - don’t tell me you can do the job when you can’t.

I am devastated by the way this shop, repaired my bag. The zipper is barely usable and requires so much strength in order to open and close the bag (not smooth whatsoever). I have not used this bag since sending it to this shop for repair, I’m honestly devastated because I used to use this bag everyday to go to school/ work and the owner refused to repair it again and insisted to charge me 60$ for a job horribly done. When I pointed out that the zipper is barely functional, all he did was rub some oil from a stick on it barely improving the issue, the oil lasts approximately one week before the zipper is unusable again. Taking a closer look at the bag at home I see that the job was done so messily, glue everywhere and the seams were not attached evenly. So upset, I can’t speak for how shoe repairs go here but be cautioned if you intend to bring a bag

originalText.text:
Anthony may be a shoe repair shop, but I experienced first hand what kind of quality keys he makes. My house key duplicate was cut great - it worked the first time! I never had a key copy cut so smoothly.
Anthony (Naftali) was very friendly, and gave me advice before I left the store on how to oil the key in the event that the copy wouldn't work well, as well as cheerfully inviting me to come back if I would have any problems.
Though $15 for a Medeco key, I'd definitely come back here over any other one of the cheap places, for the quality of the product.
